title: Fix overflow when using magma
body_html:
Fixes #2790.

The bug is that two things of type int were being multiplied and used in a function that takes something of type size_t. The multiplication of the ints overflowed and was then passed into a memory allocation function, which allocated less memory than necessary.

This fixes that by casting those ints to size_t. This doesn't work for 32-bit systems, where size_t is 32-bit -- is that a problem?

Test Plan

Check that the following doesn't segfault anymore:

import torch
x = torch.zeros(300, 100001).cuda()
u, s, v = torch.svd(x, some=True)
